planets.name: Sun
planets.description: The Sun is the star at the center of our Solar System. It is a nearly perfect sphere of hot plasma, heated to incandescence by nuclear fusion reactions in its core.
planets.fun_fact: The Sun contains 99.86% of the mass in the Solar System.

planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the smallest planet in our Solar System and the closest to the Sun. Its surface is heavily cratered and similar in appearance to Earth's Moon.
planets.fun_fact: A day on Mercury lasts 59 Earth days, but a year is only 88 Earth days.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and is Earth's closest planetary neighbor. It has a thick, toxic atmosphere filled with carbon dioxide and clouds of sulfuric acid.
planets.fun_fact: Venus rotates backwards compared to most other planets, so the Sun rises in the west.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbor life. About 71% of Earth's surface is covered with water.
planets.fun_fact: Earth is the only planet not named after a Greek or Roman god.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and is often called the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish appearance caused by iron oxide on its surface.
planets.fun_fact: Mars has the largest volcano in the Solar System - Olympus Mons, which is 3 times taller than Mount Everest.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the fifth planet from the Sun and the largest in the Solar System. It is a gas giant with a mass more than two and a half times that of all the other planets combined.
planets.fun_fact: Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a storm that has been raging for at least 400 years.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System. It is famous for its prominent ring system made of ice and rock.
planets.fun_fact: Saturn's density is so low that it would float if placed in water.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun. It has the coldest planetary atmosphere in the Solar System and rotates on its side.
planets.fun_fact: Uranus rotates at a nearly 90-degree angle from the plane of its orbit, essentially spinning on its side.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the eighth and farthest known planet from the Sun. It is the densest giant planet and has the strongest winds in the Solar System.
planets.fun_fact: Neptune's winds can reach speeds of over 2,100 km/h - the fastest in the Solar System.

planets.name: Moon
planets.description: The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite. It is the fifth largest moon in the Solar System and the largest relative to the size of its planet.
planets.fun_fact: The Moon is slowly drifting away from Earth at a rate of about 3.8 cm per year.
